usecase_1: Article 17(1) The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the 'Smart Healthcare Data Space's' 'Health Management APP' the erasure of their health records concerning them without undue delay and the APP shall have the obligation to erase personal health data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies: (a) the personal health data are no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which they were collected or otherwise processed; (b) the data subject withdraws consent on which the processing is based according to point (a) of Article 6(1), for the use case of 'personalized fitness recommendations', and where there is no other legal ground for the processing; Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the data subject has given consent to the processing of his or her personal health data for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'personalized fitness recommendations');
usecase_2: Article 17(1) A member of the 'Catena-X Automotive Network', the 'Tire Manufacturer', shall have the right to obtain from the 'Automotive OEM' the erasure of its provided tire performance test data without undue delay and the OEM shall have the obligation to erase such data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies: (a) the tire performance test data are no longer necessary in relation to the purposes of 'supply chain collaboration optimization' for which they were collected or otherwise processed; (b) the 'Tire Manufacturer' withdraws consent on which the processing is based according to point (a) of Article 6(1), for the use case of 'new vehicle model R&D', and where there is no other legal ground for the processing; Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Tire Manufacturer' has given consent to the processing of its tire performance test data for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'new vehicle model R&D');
usecase_3: Article 17(1) A user of the 'Financial Data Space' shall have the right to obtain from the 'Securities Firm' the erasure of their transaction history data without undue delay and the firm shall have the obligation to erase such personal data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies: (a) the transaction history data are no longer necessary in relation to the purpose of 'investment risk assessment' for which they were collected or otherwise processed; (b) the user withdraws consent on which the processing is based according to point (a) of Article 6(1), for the use case of 'quantitative strategy backtesting', and where there is no other legal ground for the processing; Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the user has given consent to the processing of their transaction history data for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'quantitative strategy backtesting');
usecase_4: Article 17(1) A 'Farmer' in the 'Smart Agriculture Data Space' shall have the right to obtain from the 'Agricultural Technology Provider' the erasure of their submitted soil and weather data without undue delay and the provider shall have the obligation to erase such data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies: (a) the soil and weather data are no longer necessary in relation to the purpose of 'precision irrigation model training' for which they were collected or otherwise processed; (b) the 'Farmer' withdraws consent on which the processing is based according to point (a) of Article 6(1), for the use case of 'crop pest and disease prediction', and where there is no other legal ground for the processing; Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Farmer' has given consent to the processing of their soil and weather data for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'crop pest and disease prediction');
usecase_5: Article 17(1) A participant in the 'Energy Data Space', the 'Wind Farm Operator', shall have the right to obtain from the 'Grid Dispatch Center' the erasure of its power generation forecast data without undue delay and the center shall have the obligation to erase such data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies: (a) the power generation forecast data are no longer necessary in relation to the purpose of 'grid load balancing' for which they were collected or otherwise processed; (b) the 'Wind Farm Operator' withdraws consent on which the processing is based according to point (a) of Article 6(1), for the use case of 'renewable energy integration studies', and where there is no other legal ground for the processing; Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Wind Farm Operator' has given consent to the processing of its power generation forecast data for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'renewable energy integration studies');
usecase_6: Article 13 Where 'part defect data' are collected from a 'Component Supplier', the 'Equipment Manufacturer' in the 'Industrial Data Space' shall, at the time when the data are obtained, provide the 'Component Supplier' with the following further information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing: (a) the storage period for the 'part defect data', or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period; (b) information on the 'Equipment Manufacturer' who is qualified to handle the 'Component Supplier's' rights requests, and can access, rectify, erase the 'part defect data' or restrict data rights; (c) where processing is based on point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal; Article 9(1) Processing of 'part defect data' revealing trade secrets, core technology parameters, and processing of serial numbers, production batch numbers for the purpose of uniquely identifying a specific batch of products shall be prohibited. (2) Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies: (a) the 'Component Supplier' has given explicit consent to the processing of those 'part defect data' for one or more specified purposes, such as 'supply chain quality traceability', except where industry data sharing agreements provide that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the 'Component Supplier'.
usecase_7: Article 13 Where 'real-time location data' are collected from a 'Driver', the 'Freight Platform' in the 'Smart Logistics Data Space' shall, at the time when the data are obtained, provide the 'Driver' with the following further information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing: (a) the retention period for the 'real-time location data', or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period; (b) information on the 'Freight Platform' who is qualified to handle the 'Driver's' rights requests, and can access, rectify, erase the 'real-time location data' or restrict data rights; (c) where processing is based on point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal; Article 9(1) Processing of 'real-time location data' revealing personal travel patterns, lifestyle habits, and processing of ID numbers, phone numbers for the purpose of uniquely identifying an individual shall be prohibited. (2) Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies: (a) the 'Driver' has given explicit consent to the processing of those 'real-time location data' for one or more specified purposes, such as 'route planning optimization', except where the platform's privacy policy provides that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the 'Driver'.
usecase_8: Article 13 Where 'genetic sequence data' are collected from a 'Research Participant', the 'Gene Sequencing Company' in the 'Scientific Research Data Space' shall, at the time when the data are obtained, provide the 'Research Participant' with the following further information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing: (a) the archival period for the 'genetic sequence data', or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period; (b) information on the 'Gene Sequencing Company' who is qualified to handle the 'Research Participant's' rights requests, and can access, rectify, erase the 'genetic sequence data' or restrict data rights; (c) where processing is based on point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal; Article 9(1) Processing of 'genetic sequence data' revealing genetic disease history, ethnic origin, and processing of biometric information, medical record numbers for the purpose of uniquely identifying an individual shall be prohibited. (2) Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies: (a) the 'Research Participant' has given explicit consent to the processing of those 'genetic sequence data' for one or more specified purposes, such as 'targeted drug R&D', except where research ethics review regulations provide that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the 'Research Participant'.
usecase_9: Article 13 Where 'consumption behavior data' are collected from a 'Tourist', the 'Scenic Area Operator' in the 'Smart Tourism Data Space' shall, at the time when the data are obtained, provide the 'Tourist' with the following further information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing: (a) the retention period for the 'consumption behavior data', or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period; (b) information on the 'Scenic Area Operator' who is qualified to handle the 'Tourist's' rights requests, and can access, rectify, erase the 'consumption behavior data' or restrict data rights; (c) where processing is based on point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal; Article 9(1) Processing of 'consumption behavior data' revealing personal consumption preferences, financial status, and processing of payment account numbers, contact information for the purpose of uniquely identifying an individual shall be prohibited. (2) Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies: (a) the 'Tourist' has given explicit consent to the processing of those 'consumption behavior data' for one or more specified purposes, such as 'personalized tourism product recommendation', except where the membership service agreement provides that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the 'Tourist'.
usecase_10: Article 13 Where 'learning behavior data' are collected from a 'Student', the 'Online Education Platform' in the 'Education Data Space' shall, at the time when the data are obtained, provide the 'Student' with the following further information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing: (a) the archival period for the 'learning behavior data', or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period; (b) information on the 'Online Education Platform' who is qualified to handle the 'Student's' rights requests, and can access, rectify, erase the 'learning behavior data' or restrict data rights; (c) where processing is based on point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal; Article 9(1) Processing of 'learning behavior data' revealing cognitive levels, family background, and processing of student IDs, home addresses for the purpose of uniquely identifying an individual shall be prohibited. (2) Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies: (a) the 'Student' has given explicit consent to the processing of those 'learning behavior data' for one or more specified purposes, such as 'adaptive learning path planning', except where the user service agreement provides that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the 'Student'.
usecase_11: Article 20(1) The 'Vehicle Owner' in the 'Intelligent Connected Vehicle Data Space' shall have the right to receive the 'vehicle driving data' concerning them, which they have provided to an 'Automotive Manufacturer', in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another 'Insurance Company' without hindrance from the 'Automotive Manufacturer' to which the personal data have been provided, where: (a) the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (b) of Article 6(1); and (b) the processing is carried out by automated means. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Vehicle Owner' has given consent to the processing of their 'vehicle driving data' for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'UBI (Usage-Based Insurance) pricing'); (b) processing is necessary for the performance of a 'Connected Vehicle Service Agreement' to which the 'Vehicle Owner' is party or in order to take steps at the request of the 'Vehicle Owner' prior to entering into an agreement.
usecase_12: Article 20(1) The 'Individual User' in the 'Open Banking Data Space' shall have the right to receive the 'personal account statements' concerning them, which they have provided to 'Commercial Bank A', in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another 'Consumer Finance Company' without hindrance from 'Commercial Bank A' to which the personal data have been provided, where: (a) the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (b) of Article 6(1); and (b) the processing is carried out by automated means. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Individual User' has given consent to the processing of their 'personal account statements' for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'personal credit loan approval'); (b) processing is necessary for the performance of an 'Electronic Banking Service Contract' to which the 'Individual User' is party or in order to take steps at the request of the 'Individual User' prior to entering into a contract.
usecase_13: Article 20(1) The 'Household User' in the 'Smart Energy Data Space' shall have the right to receive the 'smart meter data' concerning them, which they have provided to a 'Power Company', in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another 'Energy Service Company' without hindrance from the 'Power Company' to which the personal data have been provided, where: (a) the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (b) of Article 6(1); and (b) the processing is carried out by automated means. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Household User' has given consent to the processing of their 'smart meter data' for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'household energy efficiency analysis and optimization'); (b) processing is necessary for the performance of a 'Power Supply Contract' to which the 'Household User' is party or in order to take steps at the request of the 'Household User' prior to entering into a contract.
usecase_14: Article 20(1) The 'Exporter' in the 'Digital Trade Data Space' shall have the right to receive the 'electronic customs declaration data' concerning them, which they have provided to 'Customs', in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another 'Trade Finance Bank' without hindrance from 'Customs' to which the data have been provided, where: (a) the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (b) of Article 6(1); and (b) the processing is carried out by automated means. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Exporter' has given consent to the processing of their 'electronic customs declaration data' for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'supply chain finance credit approval'); (b) processing is necessary for the performance of a 'Trade Facilitation Agreement' to which the 'Exporter' is party or in order to take steps at the request of the 'Exporter' prior to entering into an agreement.
usecase_15: Article 20(1) The 'Job Seeker' in the 'Human Resources Data Space' shall have the right to receive the 'personal resume data' concerning them, which they have provided to 'Recruitment Platform A', in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another 'Headhunting Firm' without hindrance from 'Recruitment Platform A' to which the personal data have been provided, where: (a) the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (b) of Article 6(1); and (b) the processing is carried out by automated means. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (a) the 'Job Seeker' has given consent to the processing of their 'personal resume data' for one or more specific purposes (e.g., 'career development path planning'); (b) processing is necessary for the performance of a 'Platform User Agreement' to which the 'Job Seeker' is party or in order to take steps at the request of the 'Job Seeker' prior to entering into an agreement.
usecase_16: Article 21(1) The 'Citizen' in the 'Smart City Data Space' shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to their particular situation, at any time to processing of 'city camera footage data' concerning them which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including 'abnormal behavior analysis' based on those provisions. The 'City Administrator' shall no longer process the personal data unless the administrator demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the 'Citizen' or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (e) processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest of 'maintaining public safety' or in the exercise of official authority vested in the 'City Administrator'; (f) processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the 'City Administrator' or by a 'third-party emergency response agency', except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the 'Citizen' which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child. This shall not apply to processing carried out by 'public security authorities' in the performance of their tasks.
usecase_17: Article 21(1) The 'Borrowing Enterprise' in the 'Financial Risk Control Data Space' shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to its particular situation, at any time to processing of 'enterprise operational data' concerning it which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including 'credit risk modeling' based on those provisions. The 'Financial Institution' shall no longer process the enterprise data unless the institution demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the 'Borrowing Enterprise' or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (e) processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest of 'financial risk prevention' or in the exercise of official authority vested in the 'Financial Regulatory Authority'; (f) processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the 'Financial Institution' or by a 'third-party credit rating agency', except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the 'Borrowing Enterprise' which require protection of commercial secrets. This shall not apply to processing carried out by 'regulatory authorities' in the performance of their tasks.
usecase_18: Article 21(1) The 'Test Vehicle Driver' in the 'Autonomous Driving R&D Data Space' shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to their particular situation, at any time to processing of 'driving behavior data' concerning them which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including 'driver status monitoring' based on those provisions. The 'Automotive R&D Institution' shall no longer process the personal data unless the institution demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the 'Test Vehicle Driver' or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (e) processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest of 'traffic safety research' or in the exercise of official authority vested in the 'Traffic Management Authority'; (f) processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the 'Automotive R&D Institution' or by a 'third-party algorithm provider', except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the 'Test Vehicle Driver' which require protection of personal data. This shall not apply to processing carried out by 'traffic management authorities' in the performance of their tasks.
usecase_19: Article 21(1) The 'Resident' in the 'Public Health Data Space' shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to their particular situation, at any time to processing of 'personal health code status data' concerning them which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including 'epidemic transmission risk analysis' based on those provisions. The 'Center for Disease Control' shall no longer process the personal data unless the center demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the 'Resident' or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (e) processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest of 'epidemic prevention and control' or in the exercise of official authority vested in the 'Health Commission'; (f) processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the 'Center for Disease Control' or by a 'third-party research institution', except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the 'Resident' which require protection of personal data. This shall not apply to processing carried out by 'government authorities' in the performance of their tasks.
usecase_20: Article 21(1) The 'User' in the 'Social Media Data Space' shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to their particular situation, at any time to processing of 'social network activity data' concerning them which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including 'user profiling' based on those provisions. The 'Platform Operator' shall no longer process the personal data unless the operator demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the 'User' or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims. Article 6(1) Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: (e) processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest of 'online content governance' or in the exercise of official authority vested in the 'Cyberspace Administration'; (f) processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the 'Platform Operator' or by a 'third-party advertiser', except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the 'User' which require protection of personal data. This shall not apply to processing carried out by 'regulatory authorities' in the performance of their tasks.
usecase_21: Section 1798.105 (b) An 'Automotive Dealer' that collects personal information about 'Vehicle Owners' shall disclose, pursuant to subparagraph (A) of paragraph (5) of subdivision (a) of Section 1798.130, the 'Vehicle Owner’s' rights to request the deletion of the 'Vehicle Owner’s' personal information. Section 1798.130 (a) the 'Automotive Dealer' shall: (5) Disclose the following information in its online privacy policy or policies if the business has an online privacy policy or policies and in any California-specific description of consumers’ privacy rights, or if the business does not maintain those policies, on its Internet Web site, and update that information at least once every 12 months: (A) A description of a 'Vehicle Owner’s' rights, which shall explicitly inform a 'Vehicle Owner' that they have the following rights, and provide one or more designated methods for submitting requests: Right to Know, Right to Access, Right to Opt-Out of Sale/Sharing.
usecase_22: Section 1798.105 (b) A 'Healthcare Provider' that collects personal information about 'Patients' shall disclose, pursuant to subparagraph (A) of paragraph (5) of subdivision (a) of Section 1798.130, the 'Patient’s' rights to request the deletion of the 'Patient’s' personal information. Section 1798.130 (a) the 'Healthcare Provider' shall: (5) Disclose the following information in its online privacy policy or policies if the business has an online privacy policy or policies and in any California-specific description of consumers’ privacy rights, or if the business does not maintain those policies, on its Internet Web site, and update that information at least once every 12 months: (A) A description of a 'Patient’s' rights, which shall explicitly inform a 'Patient' that they have the following rights, and provide one or more designated methods for submitting requests: Right to Know, Right to Access, Right to Opt-Out of Sale/Sharing.
usecase_23: Section 1798.105 (b) A 'Retail E-commerce' business that collects personal information about 'Customers' shall disclose, pursuant to subparagraph (A) of paragraph (5) of subdivision (a) of Section 1798.130, the 'Customer’s' rights to request the deletion of the 'Customer’s' personal information. Section 1798.130 (a) the 'Retail E-commerce' business shall: (5) Disclose the following information in its online privacy policy or policies if the business has an online privacy policy or policies and in any California-specific description of consumers’ privacy rights, or if the business does not maintain those policies, on its Internet Web site, and update that information at least once every 12 months: (A) A description of a 'Customer’s' rights, which shall explicitly inform a 'Customer' that they have the following rights, and provide one or more designated methods for submitting requests: Right to Know, Right to Access, Right to Opt-Out of Sale/Sharing.
usecase_24: Section 1798.105 (b) A 'Gaming Company' that collects personal information about 'Players' shall disclose, pursuant to subparagraph (A) of paragraph (5) of subdivision (a) of Section 1798.130, the 'Player’s' rights to request the deletion of the 'Player’s' personal information. Section 1798.130 (a) the 'Gaming Company' shall: (5) Disclose the following information in its online privacy policy or policies if the business has an online privacy policy or policies and in any California-specific description of consumers’ privacy rights, or if the business does not maintain those policies, on its Internet Web site, and update that information at least once every 12 months: (A) A description of a 'Player’s' rights, which shall explicitly inform a 'Player' that they have the following rights, and provide one or more designated methods for submitting requests: Right to Know, Right to Access, Right to Opt-Out of Sale/Sharing.
usecase_25: Section 1798.105 (b) A 'Streaming Service Provider' that collects personal information about 'Subscribers' shall disclose, pursuant to subparagraph (A) of paragraph (5) of subdivision (a) of Section 1798.130, the 'Subscriber’s' rights to request the deletion of the 'Subscriber’s' personal information. Section 1798.130 (a) the 'Streaming Service Provider' shall: (5) Disclose the following information in its online privacy policy or policies if the business has an online privacy policy or policies and in any California-specific description of consumers’ privacy rights, or if the business does not maintain those policies, on its Internet Web site, and update that information at least once every 12 months: (A) A description of a 'Subscriber’s' rights, which shall explicitly inform a 'Subscriber' that they have the following rights, and provide one or more designated methods for submitting requests: Right to Know, Right to Access, Right to Opt-Out of Sale/Sharing.
usecase_26: Section 1798.120 (a) A 'User' shall have the right, at any time, to direct a 'Social Media Platform' that sells personal information about the 'User' to 'Data Brokers' not to sell the 'User’s' personal information. This right may be referred to as the right to opt out. (d) Notwithstanding subdivision (a), a 'Social Media Platform' shall not sell the personal information of 'Users' if the business has actual knowledge that the 'User' is less than 16 years of age, unless the 'User', in the case of 'Users' between 13 and 16 years of age, or the 'User’s' parent or guardian, in the case of 'Users' who are less than 13 years of age, has affirmatively authorized the sale of the 'User’s' personal information. A 'Social Media Platform' that willfully disregards the 'User’s' age shall be deemed to have had actual knowledge of the 'User’s' age. This right may be referred to as the 'right to opt in.'
usecase_27: Section 1798.120 (a) A 'Member' shall have the right, at any time, to direct a 'Retailer' that sells personal information about the 'Member' to 'Marketing Partners' not to sell the 'Member’s' personal information. This right may be referred to as the right to opt out. (d) Notwithstanding subdivision (a), a 'Retailer' shall not sell the personal information of 'Members' if the business has actual knowledge that the 'Member' is less than 16 years of age, unless the 'Member', in the case of 'Members' between 13 and 16 years of age, or the 'Member’s' parent or guardian, in the case of 'Members' who are less than 13 years of age, has affirmatively authorized the sale of the 'Member’s' personal information. A 'Retailer' that willfully disregards the 'Member’s' age shall be deemed to have had actual knowledge of the 'Member’s' age. This right may be referred to as the 'right to opt in.'
usecase_28: Section 1798.120 (a) A 'Subscriber' shall have the right, at any time, to direct an 'Online Magazine' that sells personal information about the 'Subscriber' to 'Third-Party Publishers' not to sell the 'Subscriber’s' personal information. This right may be referred to as the right to opt out. (d) Notwithstanding subdivision (a), an 'Online Magazine' shall not sell the personal information of 'Subscribers' if the business has actual knowledge that the 'Subscriber' is less than 16 years of age, unless the 'Subscriber', in the case of 'Subscribers' between 13 and 16 years of age, or the 'Subscriber’s' parent or guardian, in the case of 'Subscribers' who are less than 13 years of age, has affirmatively authorized the sale of the 'Subscriber’s' personal information. An 'Online Magazine' that willfully disregards the 'Subscriber’s' age shall be deemed to have had actual knowledge of the 'Subscriber’s' age. This right may be referred to as the 'right to opt in.'
usecase_29: Section 1798.120 (a) A 'Traveler' shall have the right, at any time, to direct an 'Online Travel Agency' that sells personal information about the 'Traveler' to 'Ad Networks' not to sell the 'Traveler’s' personal information. This right may be referred to as the right to opt out. (d) Notwithstanding subdivision (a), an 'Online Travel Agency' shall not sell the personal information of 'Travelers' if the business has actual knowledge that the 'Traveler' is less than 16 years of age, unless the 'Traveler', in the case of 'Travelers' between 13 and 16 years of age, or the 'Traveler’s' parent or guardian, in the case of 'Travelers' who are less than 13 years of age, has affirmatively authorized the sale of the 'Traveler’s' personal information. An 'Online Travel Agency' that willfully disregards the 'Traveler’s' age shall be deemed to have had actual knowledge of the 'Traveler’s' age. This right may be referred to as the 'right to opt in.'
usecase_30: Section 1798.120 (a) A 'Viewer' shall have the right, at any time, to direct a 'Video Streaming Platform' that sells personal information about the 'Viewer' to 'Content Delivery Networks' not to sell the 'Viewer’s' personal information. This right may be referred to as the right to opt out. (d) Notwithstanding subdivision (a), a 'Video Streaming Platform' shall not sell the personal information of 'Viewers' if the business has actual knowledge that the 'Viewer' is less than 16 years of age, unless the 'Viewer', in the case of 'Viewers' between 13 and 16 years of age, or the 'Viewer’s' parent or guardian, in the case of 'Viewers' who are less than 13 years of age, has affirmatively authorized the sale of the 'Viewer’s' personal information. A 'Video Streaming Platform' that willfully disregards the 'Viewer’s' age shall be deemed to have had actual knowledge of the 'Viewer’s' age. This right may be referred to as the 'right to opt in.'
usecase_31: Article 45 A 'Data Asset Holder' has the right to access and copy their 'data product' from a 'Data Trading Platform', except under the circumstances stipulated in Article 18 of this Law. If a 'Data Asset Holder' requests to access or copy their 'data product', the 'Data Trading Platform' shall provide it promptly. If a 'Data Asset Holder' requests to transfer their 'data product' to another 'Data Service Provider' they designate, and the conditions stipulated by the state data administration department are met, the 'Data Trading Platform' shall provide a means for the transfer. Article 18 If a 'Data Trading Platform' processes 'data products' under circumstances where laws or administrative regulations require confidentiality or do not require notification, it may not inform the 'Data Asset Holder' of the matters stipulated in the first paragraph of the preceding article.
usecase_32: Article 45 A 'Vehicle Owner' has the right to access and copy their 'vehicle mortgage information' from an 'Auto Finance Company', except under the circumstances stipulated in Article 18 of this Law. If a 'Vehicle Owner' requests to access or copy their 'vehicle mortgage information', the 'Auto Finance Company' shall provide it promptly. If a 'Vehicle Owner' requests to transfer their 'vehicle mortgage information' to another 'Commercial Bank' they designate, and the conditions stipulated by the state financial regulatory department are met, the 'Auto Finance Company' shall provide a means for the transfer. Article 18 If an 'Auto Finance Company' processes 'vehicle mortgage information' under circumstances where laws or administrative regulations require confidentiality or do not require notification, it may not inform the 'Vehicle Owner' of the matters stipulated in the first paragraph of the preceding article.
usecase_33: Article 45 A 'Policyholder' has the right to access and copy their 'insurance contract information' from an 'Insurance Company', except under the circumstances stipulated in Article 18 of this Law. If a 'Policyholder' requests to access or copy their 'insurance contract information', the 'Insurance Company' shall provide it promptly. If a 'Policyholder' requests to transfer their 'insurance contract information' to another 'Insurance Brokerage Firm' they designate, and the conditions stipulated by the state insurance supervisory and administrative department are met, the 'Insurance Company' shall provide a means for the transfer. Article 18 If an 'Insurance Company' processes 'insurance contract information' under circumstances where laws or administrative regulations require confidentiality or do not require notification, it may not inform the 'Policyholder' of the matters stipulated in the first paragraph of the preceding article.
usecase_34: Article 45 An 'Enterprise' has the right to access and copy its 'credit report' from a 'Credit Reporting Agency', except under the circumstances stipulated in Article 18 of this Law. If an 'Enterprise' requests to access or copy its 'credit report', the 'Credit Reporting Agency' shall provide it promptly. If an 'Enterprise' requests to transfer its 'credit report' to another 'Financial Institution' it designates, and the conditions stipulated by the state credit industry administrative department are met, the 'Credit Reporting Agency' shall provide a means for the transfer. Article 18 If a 'Credit Reporting Agency' processes 'credit reports' under circumstances where laws or administrative regulations require confidentiality or do not require notification, it may not inform the 'Enterprise' of the matters stipulated in the first paragraph of the preceding article.
usecase_35: Article 45 An 'Author' has the right to access and copy their 'work copyright information' from a 'Digital Publishing Platform', except under the circumstances stipulated in Article 18 of this Law. If an 'Author' requests to access or copy their 'work copyright information', the 'Digital Publishing Platform' shall provide it promptly. If an 'Author' requests to transfer their 'work copyright information' to another 'Copyright Agency' they designate, and the conditions stipulated by the state copyright administration department are met, the 'Digital Publishing Platform' shall provide a means for the transfer. Article 18 If a 'Digital Publishing Platform' processes 'work copyright information' under circumstances where laws or administrative regulations require confidentiality or do not require notification, it may not inform the 'Author' of the matters stipulated in the first paragraph of the preceding article.
usecase_36: Article 53 A 'Component Supplier' outside the territory of the 'Catena-X Data Space' as stipulated in the second paragraph of Article 3 of this Law, shall establish a dedicated entity or appoint a representative within the 'Catena-X China Node' to handle matters related to 'automotive supply chain data' protection, and shall report the name of the entity or the name and contact information of the representative to the department responsible for 'industrial data' protection. Article 3 This Law also applies to activities of processing 'production data' of 'domestic Chinese automotive manufacturers' outside the territory of the 'Catena-X Data Space' if one of the following circumstances exists: (2) for the purpose of analyzing and evaluating the production efficiency of 'domestic automotive manufacturers'.
usecase_37: Article 53 A 'Hedge Fund' outside the territory of the 'International Financial Data Network' as stipulated in the second paragraph of Article 3 of this Law, shall establish a dedicated entity or appoint a representative within 'mainland China' to handle matters related to 'financial transaction data' protection, and shall report the name of the entity or the name and contact information of the representative to the department responsible for 'financial information' protection. Article 3 This Law also applies to activities of processing 'transaction behavior data' of 'domestic Chinese investors' outside the territory of the 'International Financial Data Network' if one of the following circumstances exists: (2) for the purpose of analyzing and evaluating the investment behavior of 'domestic investors'.
usecase_38: Article 53 A 'Pharmaceutical Company' outside the territory of the 'Global Clinical Trial Data Platform' as stipulated in the second paragraph of Article 3 of this Law, shall establish a dedicated entity or appoint a representative within 'mainland China' to handle matters related to 'clinical trial data' protection, and shall report the name of the entity or the name and contact information of the representative to the department responsible for 'human genetic resources' protection. Article 3 This Law also applies to activities of processing 'health data' of 'domestic Chinese trial subjects' outside the territory of the 'Global Clinical Trial Data Platform' if one of the following circumstances exists: (2) for the purpose of analyzing and evaluating the physiological responses of 'domestic trial subjects'.
usecase_39: Article 53 An 'Overseas Retailer' outside the territory of the 'Cross-border E-commerce Data Sharing Alliance' as stipulated in the second paragraph of Article 3 of this Law, shall establish a dedicated entity or appoint a representative within 'mainland China' to handle matters related to 'consumer shopping data' protection, and shall report the name of the entity or the name and contact information of the representative to the department responsible for 'consumer rights' protection. Article 3 This Law also applies to activities of processing 'shopping preference data' of 'domestic Chinese consumers' outside the territory of the 'Cross-border E-commerce Data Sharing Alliance' if one of the following circumstances exists: (2) for the purpose of analyzing and evaluating the purchasing behavior of 'domestic consumers'.
usecase_40: Article 53 A 'Foreign Airline' outside the territory of the 'International Aviation Data Exchange Center' as stipulated in the second paragraph of Article 3 of this Law, shall establish a dedicated entity or appoint a representative within 'mainland China' to handle matters related to 'flight operations data' protection, and shall report the name of the entity or the name and contact information of the representative to the department responsible for 'civil aviation information' protection. Article 3 This Law also applies to activities of processing 'travel data' of 'domestic Chinese passengers' outside the territory of the 'International Aviation Data Exchange Center' if one of the following circumstances exists: (2) for the purpose of analyzing and evaluating the travel patterns of 'domestic passengers'.
usecase_41: Article 46 A 'mining company' that provides important data on the 'critical mineral supply chain' to a recipient outside the territory in violation of Article 31 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'natural resources authority', and may be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons may be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan; if the circumstances are serious, a fine of not less than 1 million yuan but not more than 10 million yuan shall be imposed, and it may be ordered to suspend relevant business, cease operations for rectification, or have its relevant business permit or business license revoked, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan. Article 31 The security management for the outbound transfer of important 'power grid operation' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by operators of critical information infrastructure in the 'energy sector' shall be governed by the provisions of the Cybersecurity Law of the People's Republic of China; the measures for the security management of outbound transfers of important 'oil and gas pipeline network' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by other data processors shall be formulated by the 'National Energy Administration' in conjunction with the relevant departments of the State Council.
usecase_42: Article 46 A 'gene sequencing company' that provides important 'biogene' data to a recipient outside the territory in violation of Article 31 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'science and technology authority', and may be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons may be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan; if the circumstances are serious, a fine of not less than 1 million yuan but not more than 10 million yuan shall be imposed, and it may be ordered to suspend relevant business, cease operations for rectification, or have its relevant business permit or business license revoked, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan. Article 31 The security management for the outbound transfer of important 'human genetic resources' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by operators of critical information infrastructure for 'human genetic resources information' shall be governed by the provisions of the Regulations of the People's Republic of China on the Management of Human Genetic Resources; the measures for the security management of outbound transfers of important 'biosample' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by other data processors shall be formulated by the 'state science and technology administrative department' in conjunction with the relevant departments of the State Council.
usecase_43: Article 46 A 'securities firm' that provides important 'financial market' data to a recipient outside the territory in violation of Article 31 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'financial regulatory authority', and may be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons may be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan; if the circumstances are serious, a fine of not less than 1 million yuan but not more than 10 million yuan shall be imposed, and it may be ordered to suspend relevant business, cease operations for rectification, or have its relevant business permit or business license revoked, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan. Article 31 The security management for the outbound transfer of important 'cross-border payment' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by operators of critical information infrastructure in the 'financial industry' shall be governed by the provisions of the Law of the People's Republic of China on the People's Bank of China; the measures for the security management of outbound transfers of important 'securities trading' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by other data processors shall be formulated by the 'National Administration of Financial Regulation' in conjunction with the relevant departments of the State Council.
usecase_44: Article 46 An 'automotive manufacturer' that provides important 'intelligent connected vehicle' data to a recipient outside the territory in violation of Article 31 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'industry and information technology authority', and may be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons may be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan; if the circumstances are serious, a fine of not less than 1 million yuan but not more than 10 million yuan shall be imposed, and it may be ordered to suspend relevant business, cease operations for rectification, or have its relevant business permit or business license revoked, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan. Article 31 The security management for the outbound transfer of important 'vehicle geolocation' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by operators of critical information infrastructure in the 'Internet of Vehicles' shall be governed by the provisions of the Road Traffic Safety Law of the People's Republic of China; the measures for the security management of outbound transfers of important 'autonomous driving test' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by other data processors shall be formulated by the 'state cyberspace administration' in conjunction with the relevant departments of the State Council.
usecase_45: Article 46 An 'airline' that provides important 'civil aviation operation' data to a recipient outside the territory in violation of Article 31 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'civil aviation authority', and may be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons may be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan; if the circumstances are serious, a fine of not less than 1 million yuan but not more than 10 million yuan shall be imposed, and it may be ordered to suspend relevant business, cease operations for rectification, or have its relevant business permit or business license revoked, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 100,000 yuan but not more than 1 million yuan. Article 31 The security management for the outbound transfer of important 'flight slot' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by operators of critical information infrastructure in the 'civil aviation industry' shall be governed by the provisions of the Civil Aviation Law of the People's Republic of China; the measures for the security management of outbound transfers of important 'passenger name record' data collected and generated during operations within the territory of the People's Republic of China by other data processors shall be formulated by the 'Civil Aviation Administration of China' in conjunction with the relevant departments of the State Council.
usecase_46: Article 48 A 'commercial bank' that refuses to cooperate with data access requests for 'financial risk monitoring' in violation of Article 35 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'financial regulatory authority', and shall be fined not less than 50,000 yuan but not more than 500,000 yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan. Article 35 When the 'People's Bank of China' or the 'National Administration of Financial Regulation' needs to access data for the purpose of 'maintaining financial stability' or 'preventing systemic financial risks' in accordance with the law, it shall proceed in accordance with the relevant state regulations and after strict approval procedures, and the relevant 'financial institutions' and 'payment institutions' shall cooperate.
usecase_47: Article 48 A 'polluting enterprise' that refuses to cooperate with data access requests for 'environmental pollution source tracing' in violation of Article 35 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'ecological environment authority', and shall be fined not less than 50,000 yuan but not more than 500,000 yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan. Article 35 When the 'Ministry of Ecology and Environment' or the 'State Administration for Market Regulation' needs to access data for the purpose of 'safeguarding ecological and environmental security' or 'investigating environmental violation cases' in accordance with the law, it shall proceed in accordance with the relevant state regulations and after strict approval procedures, and the relevant 'industrial parks' and 'production enterprises' shall cooperate.
usecase_48: Article 48 An 'internet platform' that refuses to cooperate with data access requests for 'cybersecurity incident investigation' in violation of Article 35 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'cyberspace administration department', and shall be fined not less than 50,000 yuan but not more than 500,000 yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan. Article 35 When 'public security organs' or 'state security organs' need to access data for the purpose of 'maintaining cyberspace sovereignty' or 'investigating cybercrimes' in accordance with the law, they shall proceed in accordance with the relevant state regulations and after strict approval procedures, and the relevant 'cloud service providers' and 'data centers' shall cooperate.
usecase_49: Article 48 A 'manufacturer' that refuses to cooperate with data access requests for 'product quality and safety traceability' in violation of Article 35 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'market supervision and administration department', and shall be fined not less than 50,000 yuan but not more than 500,000 yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan. Article 35 When the 'State Administration for Market Regulation' or the 'General Administration of Customs' needs to access data for the purpose of 'protecting consumer rights' or 'investigating product defects' in accordance with the law, it shall proceed in accordance with the relevant state regulations and after strict approval procedures, and the relevant 'distributors' and 'logistics companies' shall cooperate.
usecase_50: Article 48 A 'large tech company' that refuses to cooperate with data access requests for 'antitrust investigations' in violation of Article 35 of this Law shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning by the 'State Anti-Monopoly Bureau', and shall be fined not less than 50,000 yuan but not more than 500,000 yuan, and the directly responsible person in charge and other directly liable persons shall be fined not less than 10,000 yuan but not more than 100,000 yuan. Article 35 When the 'State Administration for Market Regulation' needs to access data for the purpose of 'maintaining fair market competition' or 'investigating monopolistic practices' in accordance with the law, it shall proceed in accordance with the relevant state regulations and after strict approval procedures, and the relevant 'industry associations' and 'related enterprises' shall cooperate.
